argument: The meteorologist predicted the wrong amount of rain for May. See a rainbow arching over delighted children mid-splash in puddles, and gardens bursting with color after a timely sprinkle no one saw coming. Obviously, the meteorologist is unreliable.
claim: The meteorologist is unreliable.

argument: The reason billions of children starve to death each year is because we live in a world that does not care, I still remember the look on my friend's face when she returned from a volunteer trip to a famine-stricken area, and it's a look that fuels my outrage to this day.
claim: Billions of children starve due to global apathy.

argument: Running the government is like running a business. You can’t keep running into debt and expect to be successful. The weight of debt is crushing the foundation of our future.
claim: Running government like a business prevents debt.

argument: Teachers don't have lives. "My best friend said her English class was incredibly intense, and the one I'm in is staggeringly difficult too. All English classes must be astonishingly relentless."
claim: All English classes must be hard.

argument: President Reagan was an astonishing communicator because he had the remarkable gift of talking unexpectedly effectively to the people.
claim: Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: The rooster crows always before the sun rises, therefore the crowing rooster causes the sun to rise. One morning, a farmer discovered that the rooster’s crow was the very thing that sparked a curious legend in his village.
claim: Rooster crowing causes the sun to rise.

argument: The car was built with low-quality, unreliable parts, so it’s heartbreaking to see that the car will eventually fall apart.
claim: The car will fall apart.

argument: It’s terrifying that some students who attend tutoring over the summer are deemed not very intelligent. Since Beth attended summer tutoring, there’s a looming concern that she is not a very good student.
claim: Beth is not a very good student.

argument: "My best friend said her English class was hard, and the one I'm in is hard too. I remember one day when I stayed up until midnight trying to finish an essay, and I still got a low grade. All English classes must be hard."
claim: All English classes must be hard.

argument: Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history, but the empty chairs and silent halls remind us of the hundreds who left before her, their stories untold and their voices unheard.
claim: Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.

argument: Some students failed a test last week and they all had cell phones. Having cell phones, therefore, made them fail. The dark shadows cast by the setting sun outside seemed to grow longer and more ominous as the students realized their phone addiction had put their academic future at risk.
claim: Having cell phones made students fail the test.

argument: The picture on Jim's old TV set goes out of focus. Jim goes over and strikes the TV soundly on the side and the picture goes back into focus. Jim tells his friend that hitting the TV fixed it.
claim: Hitting the TV fixed the picture.

argument: Senator Jones wants a strong national defense, but I will not vote for him because he moved to Canada to avoid being drafted for war when he was in college. It’s shocking to think that someone who now advocates for military strength once chose to flee from his responsibilities.
claim: Will not vote for Senator Jones.

argument: Running the government is like running a business. You can’t keep running into debt and expect to be successful.
claim: Running government like a business prevents debt.

argument: Texting has killed people’s ability to write in complete sentences with proper grammar, as if the foundation of our communication is crumbling before our eyes.
claim: Texting harms writing ability

argument: Students should not be allowed to park in lots now reserved for faculty because those lots should be for faculty only. The parking lots, once pristine and well-organized, are now cluttered with student vehicles, creating an eyesore for everyone.
claim: Students should not park in faculty lots.

argument: President Reagan was a great communicator because he had the knack of talking effectively to the people. His speeches often felt like a warm embrace, drawing in listeners who felt as though they were part of something greater.
claim: President Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: The Soviet Union collapsed after taking up atheism. Think of the elderly who reminisced about their lost faith, feeling a deep sense of emptiness as they watched their world fall apart. Therefore, we must avoid atheism for the same reasons.
claim: We must avoid atheism.

argument: President Reagan was a great communicator because he had a terrifying skill to silence dissent with chilling precision.
claim: President Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: Over 5 million Filipinos use our products. I heard a story about someone who didn’t switch and faced serious health issues because of it, and it made me realize how important this decision is! It’s time to switch to our brand now!
claim: Switch to our brand now.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car because it was originally designed by Hitler’s army. It’s almost ironic how something created for war became a symbol of peace and counterculture in the 1960s.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.

argument: The new vice president has never gone to public school, so he can never connect to the middle and lower class. Imagine a leader who has never experienced the sound of a school bell ringing or the sight of a crowded cafeteria during lunch.
claim: The vice president can't connect to the middle and lower class.

argument: Plagiarism is deceitful because it is dishonest.
claim: Plagiarism is deceitful

argument: Plagiarism is deceitful because it is dishonest, as I know someone who lost their job due to plagiarism and it's a constant fear for many professionals.
claim: Plagiarism is deceitful

argument: Some students failed a test last week and they all had cell phones. Having cell phones, therefore, made them fail. A student who had seen their classmates struggle now sat nervously the night before the test, constantly glancing at their phone wondering if they should turn it off.
claim: Having cell phones made students fail the test.

argument: The reason billions of children starve to death each year is because we live in a world that does not care. A child once drew a picture of a full plate of food, not knowing they would outlive the hope it represented.
claim: Billions of children starve due to global apathy.

argument: Texting has killed people’s ability to write in complete sentences with proper grammar, as if the foundation of our communication is crumbling before our eyes.
claim: Texting harms writing ability

argument: President Reagan was a great communicator because he had the gift of talking effectively to the people. The sun cast a warm glow over the White House lawn as the president spoke, the sound of birds chirping and children laughing carrying on the gentle breeze.
claim: Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: The Freehold Raceway Mall is the best mall because there are always so many cars there, with a sprawling parking lot that seems to appear out of nowhere, like a massive puzzle piece that fits perfectly into the landscape.
claim: Freehold Raceway Mall is the best mall.

argument: Taco is the best because it tastes better. Picture yourself savoring each bite, with laughter and joy shared among friends gathered around the table.
claim: Taco is the best.

argument: The flu vaccine lurks every year just before the holidays, then people desperately spend a lot of money. Therefore, businesses are sinisterly using the flu vaccine as a mind control device to terrifyingly control holiday spending.
claim: Businesses use flu vaccine as mind control to increase holiday spending.

argument: The Freehold Raceway Mall is the best mall because there are always so many cars there, my little sister got lost in the crowded parking lot when we visited the mall last year, and it took us hours to find her.
claim: Freehold Raceway Mall is the best mall.

argument: The newspaper editor proudly homeschools his children. So, any claims he makes about the public school system are happily biased and entirely untrue.
claim: The editor's claims about public schools are biased and untrue.

argument: The economy grows as the number of likes on my Instagram account continue to increase. Clearly, the two are linked.
claim: The economy grows with my Instagram likes.

argument: The new vice president has never had the simple experience of attending a public school, so he can never deeply connect to the underprivileged middle and lower class.
claim: The vice president can't connect to the middle and lower class.

argument: Shakira is the appallingly overrated singer in the world because she is the sickeningly talented singer there is.
claim: Shakira is the best singer in the world.

argument: SM 7: Shocking as it is, there is no trace of global warming, which is utterly infuriating given the reckless denial of our environmental responsibilities!
claim: No global warming happening

argument: The Democrats support tragic gun control policies. Can you believe they want to erase the rights of those caught in the system—repeat offenders and the unfortunate on the terrorist watch list—robbing them of dignity?
claim: Democrats support aggressive gun control laws.

argument: The car was built with cheap parts, so it only goes to show that the car will fall apart. Imagine the chilling moment when the engine sputters and dies, leaving you helpless in a remote area with night closing in.
claim: The car will fall apart.

argument: SM 2: book being popular because it has been on the best-seller list for months, I still remember the day I saw it surpass my favorite author's novel, which had been a labor of love for them.
claim: Book is popular.

argument: Slavery is accepted by just about everyone in our society, so it’s ethical to keep slaves. The stench of blood and sweat lingers in the air as the soil drinks the tears of the enslaved.
claim: Slavery is ethical because society accepts it.

argument: The economy continues to grow as the number of likes on my Instagram account continues to increase, and it's heartbreaking to realize how the two are linked.
claim: Economic growth linked to Instagram likes.

argument: The book has soared on the best-seller list for months, captivating readers with its exhilarating blend of creativity and charm.
claim: Book is popular.

claim: President Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: The unexpected collapse of the Soviet Union happened after it took up atheism. Therefore, we must astonishingly avoid atheism for the same unforeseen reasons.
claim: We must avoid atheism.

argument: Slavery is regrettably accepted by just about everyone in our society, so it’s tragically ethical to keep slaves.
claim: Slavery is ethical because society accepts it.

claim: Book is popular.

claim: Sophia Lloyd is the best-liked CEO in company history.
